questions.text: A patient complaing of chronic nasal obstruction since last 6 months was operated 2 months back and now present with crusts and bleeding.Study the nasal examination image and comment on the surgery which was done ?

A 33-year-old male met with a road traffic accident. There is persistent watery discharge mixed with blood from his nose for 3 days which cannot be sniffed back. Which of the following should not be done in this condition?

options.label: B
options.text: Plan surgical treatment with functional endoscopic sinus surgery

options.label: C
options.text: Bed rest and avoiding strenuous activity

questions.correct_answer: B. Plan surgical treatment with functional endoscopic sinus surgery

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about Eustachian tube?

options.label: A
options.text: Medial 24 mm is cartilaginous and lateral 12 mm is bony

options.label: B
options.text: Its angled at 45 degrees with horizontal but in children it is more horizontal

options.label: C
options.text: The opening of Eustachian tube lies 1.5 cm behind the posterior end of middle turbinate in the nasopharynx

options.label: D
options.text: Tensor palati is the main muscle to open the Eustachian tube

questions.correct_answer: C. The opening of Eustachian tube lies 1.5 cm behind the posterior end of middle turbinate in the nasopharynx

options.label: A
options.text: Surgery is the mainstay of treatment

options.label: B
options.text: Electrocochleography is the gold standard investigation for diagnosis

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: B. Electrocochleography is the gold standard investigation for diagnosis

A 30-year-old male presents with foul smelling ear discharge. On examination external auditory canal was full of granulations and the tympanic membrane appeared as the picture given below. Which of the following will be part of management: 1. Antibiotics 2. Decongestants 3. Radical mastoidectomy 4. Modified radical mastoidectomy 5. Myringoplasty

A 25-year-old female, with history of left modified radical mastoidectomy 2 months prior for cholesteatoma, presented with one-week history of foul smelling blood stained ear discharge,fever, otalgia, neck pain, and neck swelling, with reduced neck movement. On examination, she appeared ill with high spiking fever and the left postauricular wound dehiscence was discharging pus.All of the following statements are true regarding diagnosis except:

options.label: A
options.text: Brain abscess is the second most common intra cranial complication.

options.label: B
options.text: Ironing of mastoid is the earliest sign.

options.label: C
options.text: Gradenigo triad raises the possibility of involvement of 5 and 10 nerve.

options.label: D
options.text: HRCT is the investigation of choice diplopia present.

questions.correct_answer: C. Gradenigo triad raises the possibility of involvement of 5 and 10 nerve.

options.label: A
options.text: a d e f b c g

options.label: B
options.text: b c g a d e f

options.label: C
options.text: e f b a d c g

options.label: D
options.text: a d e f c g b

questions.correct_answer: A. a d e f b c g

questions.text: Laryngeal videostroboscopy helps to differentiate benign from early malignant lesions of vocal cord by

questions.text: All of the following are true about nasopharyngeal carcinoma except

options.label: A
options.text: Epstein-Barr virus is an etiological agent

options.label: B
options.text: Bilateral conductive deafness in an adult patient is a common presentation

options.label: C
options.text: Cervical lymph node metastasis is seen in 75% patients

options.label: D
options.text: Commonest histopathological type is undifferentiated carcinoma

questions.correct_answer: B. Bilateral conductive deafness in an adult patient is a common presentation

questions.text: All of the following are true about juvenile angiofibroma except

options.label: B
options.text: Weber Fergusson’s trans maxillary approach is ideal for angiofibroma limited to nose & nasopharynx

questions.correct_answer: B. Weber Fergusson’s trans maxillary approach is ideal for angiofibroma limited to nose & nasopharynx

questions.text: Which of the following is not a true statement regarding adenoids

options.label: A

options.label: C
options.text: Adenoidectomy is contraindicated in submucous cleft palate

questions.correct_answer: D. Digital palpation of adenoid tissue should be avoided before removal in adenoidectomy

questions.text: Adenoidectomy & Myringotomy with grommet insertion is treatment of choice for?

options.label: A
options.text: Serous otitis media in children with adenoid hypertrophy

options.label: B
options.text: Tubotympanic otitis media in children with adenoid hypertrophy

options.label: C
options.text: Adenoid Hypertrophy in children with atticoantral CSOM

options.label: D
options.text: Children with history of mouth breathing

questions.correct_answer: A. Serous otitis media in children with adenoid hypertrophy

questions.text: A 12-year-old previously healthy child presented to the emergency department with fever, throat pain, and difficulty breathing. The previous history was unremarkable, except for perforated appendicitis 15 months prior. One week prior to admission, the patient reported the symptom of a sore throat that improved slightly after 2 days of self-prescribed penicillin. However, a worsening sore throat returned the day prior to admission. In the ED, the patient was found to have a right-sided sore throat, pain while swallowing, odynophagia, poor oral (p.o.) intake, right neck tenderness, and a fever of 40.1°C. The patient also reported a recent development of trismus and muffled “hot potato” voice. X-Ray demonstrate unilateral soft tissue swelling posterior to the pharynx, with a widening of the prevertebral soft tissue. All of the following are true about diagnosis except

options.label: A
options.text: Examination of pharynx shows a midline bulge on posterior pharyngeal wall

options.label: B
options.text: Mostly presents as a paediatric airway emergency

options.label: C
options.text: X ray soft tissue neck lateral view shows widening of prevertebral shadow

options.label: D
options.text: Retropharyngeal space extends from skull base to bifurcation of trachea

questions.correct_answer: A. Examination of pharynx shows a midline bulge on posterior pharyngeal wall

questions.text: A male in 2nd decade of life has multiple recurrent nasal bleeding with recurrent nasal blockage.
